result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus J Gonzalez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to the other probation sentences.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

of Conviction (DOC-37) - to be paid off by the end of February and if not, defendant to spend 10 days in jail for every month not paid.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
Order/Judgment Extending Probation For Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (02/14/2020)
and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing

8:32 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Brandee Morris present in court via telephone.  Statement by defendant, gave the agent some money a couple of weeks ago.  Agent Morris confirms, but some went for restitution on another case.  Statement by defendant, gets paid every 2 weeks.  Court orders defendant to pay with his 2 pay periods.  Further statement by the defendant, believes he can have paid off with the two pay periods.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Defendant to have paid off by the end of February and if not paid, will have to spend 10 days in jail for every month not paid off.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. 

Court adjourned at 8:36 a.m.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (02/14/2019)

1:09 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Brandee Morris present in court via telephone.  Court goes over monies owed.  Statement by defendant. Court has no objection to the defendant serving his sentence in another county if the county will accept him.  Court informs defendant to submit an inmate request and will amend the JOC, has no objection to serving out of county or out of county travel.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year, if not paid, may extend again and/or will add jail time.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:16 p.m.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing hearing held on February 14, 2017, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Karen Blair - Court Reporter

2:06 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has received a copy of the presentence investigation report and alternative presentence investigation report and believes the incorrect information from the original PSI has been addressed in the alternative PSI.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report and the alternative presentance investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Statement by Robert Dore.

Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CF76 (Count 1 & Count 5)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 4 years.

2016CF1 (Count 1)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 4 years.

CONDITIONS (2015CF76 & 2016CF1):

-Court costs
-2015CF76 (Count 1) - 1 year county jail.  Court orders the first 6 months to be served without huber and then the last 6 months huber to include release for counseling.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.
-2015CF76 - Restitution of $250.00
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2015CM249 (Count 1)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year, concurrent to the other probation sentences.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $315.00.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:31 p.m.

By Atty Barb Privat
Sentencing hearing on October 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.

11:10 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 & 5 on 2015CF76, count 1 on 2016CF1 and count 1 on 2015CM249 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as repeaters.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 5 on 2015CF76, strikes the repeater and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2016CF1 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2015CM249.  Court orders the judgment of convictions be entered here today. Court orders a pre-sentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court in 60 days.  Court sets for sentencing on October 18, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:19 a.m.
